text: Richard Mulligan (November 13, 1932 - September 26, 2000) was an American television program and movie actor who starred primarily in sitcoms. He was especially notable for his role as Dr. Harry Weston in the TV sitcom The Golden Girls and the 1970s sitcom Soap. Mulligan was born in New York City. He died due to colorectal cancer on September 26, 2000 in Los Angeles, California, aged 67. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Actors from New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American voice actors Category:American television actors Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:1932 births Category:2000 deaths
title: Richard Mulligan
